security: Disclosing an individual's recruitment as an asset and the specific financial arrangements, including banking details, could expose the individual to risk and compromise ongoing intelligence operations. It also could reveal the CIA's methods of financial disbursement. Quoting directly, "Subject has been recruited by the Habana Station at the rate of $300.00 per month effective 1 June 1960... It is requested that Finance Division deposit the monthly salary of Subject to (account No. 44-335-104, Whitney National Bank of New Orleans...)"
summary: A memo from J.D. Sterling to the Chief of the Finance Division regarding Emilio Americo Rodriguez's recruitment by the Habana Station and the arrangement for his monthly salary payments.
summary_one_paragraph: This memorandum, dated July 12, 1960, from J.D. Sterling (C/WH/4) to the Chief of the Finance Division, details the recruitment of Emilio Americo Rodriguez by the Habana Station effective June 1, 1960. It instructs the Finance Division to deposit Rodriguez's monthly salary of $300.00 into his account at the Whitney National Bank of New Orleans (account No. 44-335-104), beginning with a deposit for June made on June 30, 1960, and continuing monthly until further notice. The memo specifies that no taxes are to be withheld from Rodriguez's salary.
title: Emilio Americo RODRIGUEZ
